message: I'm excited to offer you this incredible product for a price that I think is a great value. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1200000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a deal like this anywhere else. What do you think?
I appreciate your enthusiasm, Alice, but I think your price is a bit steep. I'm willing to meet you halfway and pay $900000 for the product. Can you consider my offer?

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Bob, but I'm afraid $900000 is still a bit low for me. I'm willing to compromise, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. I'm thinking of $1100000. Can you consider this counteroffer?

I understand that you're trying to get closer to your minimum price, Alice, but $1100000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and pay $1050000 for the product. Can you consider my offer?

I appreciate your persistence, Bob, but I'm still a bit far from my target. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. I'm thinking of $1150000. Can you consider this final offer?
I understand that you're making one more concession, Alice, but $1150000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay $1120000 for the product, which is my final offer. Can you consider it?

I'm surprised you're still willing to negotiate, Bob. I appreciate your persistence, but I've already made several concessions. I'm afraid I'm not willing to go any lower than $1150000. If you're not willing to meet me at that price, I'll have to consider other options. My final offer stands at $1150000. What do you say?
